docs.lead_paragraph: BECKER--David V., M.D. We are saddened by the loss of our dear friend and colleague Dr. David V. Becker. Founding director of the Division of Nuclear Medicine at New York - Presbyterian Hospital/Weill Cornell Medical Center and professor of radiology and medicine at Weill Cornell Medical College, Dr. Becker was a much beloved member of our Medical Center for more than 50 years. A pioneer in his field, he conducted research leading to the development of national and international policies for treating people exposed to radiation from reactor accidents. He headed the National Cancer Institute's team investigating the effects of the 1986 Chernobyl reactor accident and helped create health monitoring and treatment plans for those affected. He also advanced the treatment of hyperthyroidism, thyroid cancer and other endocrine diseases. We offer our heartfelt condolences to his wife, Lois Lunin; his children, Susan and Daniel Becker; and his four grandchildren. Herbert Pardes, M.D. President and CEO NY-Presbyterian Hospital Antonio M. Gotto, Jr., M.D. Dean, Weill Cornell Medical College

docs.lead_paragraph: Without her family’s knowledge, doctors used cancer cells from Henrietta Lacks to develop vaccines and life-saving drugs, a case examined in a book that looks at the issue of “tissue rights.”

headline.seo: Use of a Woman’s Cells Raises Ethical Questions
headline.main: A Lasting Gift to Medicine That Wasn’t Really a Gift
headline.print_headline: A Lasting Gift to Medicine That Wasn’t Really a Gift

docs.snippet: Without her family’s knowledge, doctors used cancer cells from Henrietta Lacks to develop vaccines and life-saving drugs, a case examined in a book that looks at the issue of “tissue rights.”
